content: * has DVHREQ2289I completed; with RC = 0. RDR FILE 0081 SENT FROM DIRMAINT PUN WAS 0730 RECS 0024 CPY 001 A NOHOLD NOKEEP 2. Receive the file from the reader: ===> receive 81 (replace 3. Edit the entry: ===> xedit LNXPDFLT direct a 4. Send the changed definition back to the directory: ===> dirm for LNXPDFLT replace 5. Erase the local copy of the definition. It contains passwords, and DirMaint is the authoritative source; therefore, you do not need to retain the temporary copy: ===> erase LNXPDFLT direct A Chapter 11. Deploying and maintaining Linux workloads 367 11.4.9 Deleting a user Sometimes, it is necessary to remove a user from the directory. You can erase a user with a single command: ===> dirm for <userid> purge If you want to also ensure that the abandoned minidisk extents are scrubbed clean, use this command instead: ===> dirmaint for <userid> purge (clean 11.4.10 Adding a minidisk to a user or identity The setup procedure for this task is described in “Configuring z/VM to
